meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone else for entertainment or deception.
meanings.sent1: The personator at the party was so convincing that no one could tell it wasn't really the famous singer.
meanings.sent2: The talented personator entertained the audience with spot-on impressions of various celebrities.
meanings.sent3: The personator's performance was so good, they almost fooled the security guards into letting them backstage.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to transform into different characters made her a true personator of emotions and personalities.
meanings.sent5: The personator's skill at mimicry was so impressive that even the birds in the park stopped to listen.

meanings.definition: To impersonate or mimic someone else.
meanings.sent1: He decided to personator his favorite actor for the school talent show.
meanings.sent2: She can personator her sister's voice perfectly, fooling everyone on the phone.
meanings.sent3: The comedian personatored the president in a hilarious skit that had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His ability to personator different accents made him a sought-after voice actor.
meanings.sent5: She could personator the teacher's strict tone so well that even the class bully listened attentively.
